input.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: information that is put into a computer
input.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: If the input data specified it, the file will close and the process terminates.
input.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: ideas, advice, money, or effort that you put into a job or activity in order to help it succeed
input.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Farmers contributed most of the input into the survey.
We’ll need input from community nurses.
input.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: electrical power that is put into a machine for it to use

input.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The information is input to our computer system.
input.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: something or someone that is involved or used in a business
input.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: the value of the product as compared with the cost of the inputs
an operation with an annual government input of £12 million
Costs of all factor inputs could be reduced.
input.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: ideas or advice from someone that helps to make something better or more successful
input.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Please give us your views as we value our customers’ input.
Geoff works out the designs with a lot of input from Alice.
